THTR 110.courseDesc: A beginning course in speech for the stage. The study of standard American speech, techniques for vocal projection, oral interpretation and the effective use of the voice on stage.
THTR 110.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 115.courseDesc: This course explores the Theatrical Experience from a non-practitioner's perspective. Through lectures, demonstrations, slides and videos students will examine the roles of theatre artists and how they combine their efforts in creating a unique Theatrical Experience.
THTR 115.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 116.courseDesc: Philadelphia Theatre Let's Go! exposes students to the variety of theatrical opportunities available in the Philadelphia region. Through research, discussion and attendance at theatrical productions, students will enhance their abilities to discuss, evaluate and enjoy theatre.
THTR 116.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 121.courseDesc: Through the reading of play-scripts, this course will expose students to a variety of methods of play analysis that can be applied to the various theatre disciplines (production, performance, and design). It will also provide students with the methodology to be used in the Theatre History and upper theatre courses.
THTR 121.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 130.courseDesc: Provides an introduction to the tools, equipment and basic procedures required to enable students to participate in the technical aspects of a theatrical production.
THTR 130.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 131.courseDesc: Provides practical experience in acting for the stage. Requires student to play a role in a Department of Performing Arts theatre production. May be repeated for credit.
THTR 131.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 131.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 132.courseDesc: Provides practical experience in theatre production. Requires students to participate in planning, preparation, and completion of a realized production as a crew head or crew member. May be repeated for credit.
THTR 132.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 132.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 133.courseDesc: This class provides practical experience in Theatre Management including Production Management, Stage Management, Box Office Management, and other Administrative Management areas for live theatrical events. Students are required to participate in a production for the Theatre Program.
THTR 133.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 133.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 134.courseDesc: Students will gain hands on experience running a performance venue on campus. Students are responsible for daily operations of Late Night Series Productions including: financial operations, strategic planning, artistic management, volunteer coordination, strategic partnerships, artist recruitment and management, marketing, and internet presence. Also all production elements including: sound design and operation, light design and operation, and stage management and run crew.
THTR 134.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 134.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 141.courseDesc: The Theater Performance Ensemble focuses on a specific area of performance training, creation, and research to supplement the standard theater curriculum in performance. Each quarter focuses on a specific area with emphasis on learning as an ensemble and a priority on developing new skills.
THTR 141.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 141.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 142.courseDesc: This course provides practical experience in acting for the stage through participation in a student directed one-act play in conjunction with the Play Directing Class.
THTR 142.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 142.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 143.courseDesc: An introductory course for singers and non-singers emphasizing applying acting techniques to the performance of a song. Focus will be placed on lyrics, and advancing dramatic action through the song. The class will conclude with a public performance of the material students have worked on in class.
THTR 143.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 143.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 144.courseDesc: This course provides practical experience in acting and dramaturgy for the stage through the participation, development, and performance of student written plays.
THTR 144.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 144.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR 145.courseDesc: This course provides practical experience in various forms of Theater Improvisation. Students will put basic skills into practice including listening, building relationships in a trusting ensemble, risk-taking, letting go of fear, spontaneity, and being present. This course will lead to a public presentation of the skills learned.
THTR 145.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 145.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
THTR 145.prereqs: THTR 209 [Min Grade C] (Can be taken Concurrently)

THTR 209.courseDesc: This course is designed to develop spontaneity and increase listening skills. It will begin with exercises in trust building, listening and ensemble building. It will then progress to scenes to increase skill, and by the end of the quarter students will learn long form work that will lead to performance.
THTR 209.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 210.courseDesc: Introductory acting course. Covers basic exercises, improvisations, fundamentals of voice production, and stage movement.
THTR 210.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 211.courseDesc: ContinuesTHTR 210. Intermediate course in acting, focusing on application of the techniques of acting through scene study.
THTR 211.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 211.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 5 times for 12 credits

THTR 212.courseDesc: This course explores the various techniques employed by sketch comedians to imagine and create scripts which spring from a specific point of view. Through exercises and assignments, sketch comedy will be explored as it relates to collaborates writing, improvisation, character development and the rehearsal process.
THTR 212.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 221.courseDesc: This course will expose students to the origins of drams from antiquity through the Jacobean period. Through the reading of plays and text, students will explore the relationship of the drama to the social, political, and trends within a given period and how they influenced one another.
THTR 221.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 221.prereqs: THTR 121 [Min Grade D] or HUM 103 [Min Grade D] or HUM 105 [Min Grade A] or HUM 108 [Min Grade D] or ENGL 103 [Min Grade D] or ENGL 105 [Min Grade A] or ENGL 103 [Min Grade D]

THTR 222.courseDesc: This course continues the study of drama beginning with the Restoration and continuing through the modern era. Through the reading of plays and texts, students will explore the relationship of the drama to the social, political, and economic trends within a given period and how the influenced one another.
THTR 222.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 231.courseDesc: The Musical is one of America’s greatest contributions to the world of theatre. Through class discussions, viewing live performance, audio/video examples, and readings students will explore the development of the American Musical from the Minstrel show through the Golden Age of the Musical.
THTR 231.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 232.courseDesc: The Musical is one of America’s greatest contributions to the world of theatre. Through class discussions, viewing live performance, audio/video examples, and readings students will analyze the changes in the American Musical form beginning in the 1960s to the present and predict its future direction.
THTR 232.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 240.courseDesc: Uses lectures, discussions, and practical experience to introduce the processes and equipment used in the production of plays, including scenery construction, lighting, sound, and costuming.
THTR 240.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 260.courseDesc: This course will allow students to expand on principles learned in Dramatic Writing enabling them to develop and communicate, through a variety of means, a unified production concept for a playscript. Students will present their designs in the areas of scenery, costumes and lighting demonstrating their ability to translate their production concept into theatrical reality.
THTR 260.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 320.courseDesc: Introduces the art of directing, including play analysis, interpretation, rehearsal procedures, techniques of blocking, composition, picturization, and director-actor communications.
THTR 320.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 320.prereqs: THTR 211 [Min Grade D] and THTR 121 [Min Grade D]

THTR 360.courseDesc: This course provides students with a complete introduction to the Theatrical Lighting Design, including discussions of color, composition, movement and electricity. Students apply the principles discusses in a theatre laboratory setting and are prepared to create innovative and practical designs for the stage.
THTR 360.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

THTR 495.courseDesc: Provides supervised individual study of special subjects in theatre. May be repeated for credit.
THTR 495.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR 495.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
THTR I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
THTR I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
THTR I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
THTR I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
THTR T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
THTR T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR T380.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
THTR T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR T480.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
THTR T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
THTR T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
